oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Produktivität verschiedener Sojasorten im ostösterreichischen Anbaugebiet
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hofer, Mag. MA Michaela
Schweiger, Dr. Peter
Putz, DI Berta
Hartl, Dr. Wilfried
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In Austria organic soybeans are mainly produced in the eastern part of the country due to its temperature requirements. To examine genotypic differences with respect to seed quality a three-year field trial with seven soybean cultivars was conducted. The cultivar `Essor´ showed significantly higher (p<0,05) values for corn yield, thousand grain weight and seed protein content in all three years compared to to the early maturing cultivar `Merlin´. During the whole observation period the cultivars `Essor´and `Lambton´ produced most stable corn yields while ´Essor´ and ´Cardiff´ revealed most stable seed protein contents. Based on our results, soybean cultivars of maturity group 00 had higher grain yields as well as higher seed protein content in comparison to early maturing cultivars (maturity group 000) grown under natural conditions prevalent in eastern Austria.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hofer, Mag. MA Michaela; Schweiger, Dr. Peter; Putz, DI Berta and Hartl, Dr. Wilfried (2009) Produktivität verschiedener Sojasorten im ostösterreichischen Anbaugebiet. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
